channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Does Manipulating Tokenization Aid Cross-Lingual Transfer? A Study on POS Tagging for Non-Standardized Languages
item.description: This can for instance be observed when finetuning PLMs on one language and evaluating them on data in a closely related language variety with no standardized orthography.

item.title: Road Genome: A Topology Reasoning Benchmark for Scene Understanding in Autonomous Driving
item.description: By introducing Road Genome (OpenLane-V2), we intend to shift the community's attention and take a step further beyond perception - to the task of topology reasoning for scene structure.

item.title: StoManager1: Automated, High-throughput Tool to Measure Leaf Stomata Using Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Stomatal characteristics of leaves are crucial for plant physiological performance and ecological functioning in regulating global water and carbon cycling.

item.title: Learning Bottleneck Concepts in Image Classification
item.description: Using some image classification tasks as our testbed, we demonstrate BotCL's potential to rebuild neural networks for better interpretability.

item.title: Towards replacing precipitation ensemble predictions systems using machine learning
item.description: We demonstrate the feasibility of generating realistic precipitation ensemble members on unseen higher resolutions.

item.title: A geometry-aware deep network for depth estimation in monocular endoscopy
item.description: To address this issue, we introduce a gradient loss to penalize edge fluctuations ambiguous around stepped edge structures and a normal loss to explicitly express the sensitivity to frequently small structures, and propose a geometric consistency loss to spreads the spatial information across the sample grids to constrain the global geometric anatomy structures.

item.title: Noisy Universal Domain Adaptation via Divergence Optimization for Visual Recognition
item.description: To transfer the knowledge learned from a labeled source domain to an unlabeled target domain, many studies have worked on universal domain adaptation (UniDA), where there is no constraint on the label sets of the source domain and target domain.

item.title: Prompt-Learning for Cross-Lingual Relation Extraction
item.description: Experiments on WMT17-EnZh XRE also show the effectiveness of our Prompt-XRE against other competitive baselines.

item.title: Censoring chemical data to mitigate dual use risk
item.description: The dual use of machine learning applications, where models can be used for both beneficial and malicious purposes, presents a significant challenge.

item.title: Feature-compatible Progressive Learning for Video Copy Detection
item.description: Video Copy Detection (VCD) has been developed to identify instances of unauthorized or duplicated video content.

item.title: Revisiting Implicit Neural Representations in Low-Level Vision
item.description: Implicit Neural Representation (INR) has been emerging in computer vision in recent years.

item.title: Certified Adversarial Robustness Within Multiple Perturbation Bounds
item.description: We further propose a novel \textit{training noise distribution} along with a \textit{regularized training scheme} to improve the certification within both $\ell_1$ and $\ell_2$ perturbation norms simultaneously.

item.title: Image-text Retrieval via preserving main Semantics of Vision
item.description: To address this issue, this paper presents a semantic optimization approach, implemented as a Visual Semantic Loss (VSL), to assist the model in focusing on an image's main content.

item.title: Effective Open Intent Classification with K-center Contrastive Learning and Adjustable Decision Boundary
item.description: In this paper, we introduce novel K-center contrastive learning and adjustable decision boundary learning (CLAB) to improve the effectiveness of open intent classification.

item.title: CKBP v2: An Expert-Annotated Evaluation Set for Commonsense Knowledge Base Population
item.description: Populating Commonsense Knowledge Bases (CSKB) is an important yet hard task in NLP, as it tackles knowledge from external sources with unseen events and entities.

item.title: Omni Aggregation Networks for Lightweight Image Super-Resolution
item.description: While lightweight ViT framework has made tremendous progress in image super-resolution, its uni-dimensional self-attention modeling, as well as homogeneous aggregation scheme, limit its effective receptive field (ERF) to include more comprehensive interactions from both spatial and channel dimensions.

item.title: Learning to Program with Natural Language
item.description: Therefore, we further propose the Learning to Program (LP) method to ask LLMs themselves to learn natural language programs from the training dataset of complex tasks and then use the learned program to guide inference.

item.title: PED-ANOVA: Efficiently Quantifying Hyperparameter Importance in Arbitrary Subspaces
item.description: The recent rise in popularity of Hyperparameter Optimization (HPO) for deep learning has highlighted the role that good hyperparameter (HP) space design can play in training strong models.

item.title: Learning Cellular Coverage from Real Network Configurations using GNNs
item.description: Cellular coverage quality estimation has been a critical task for self-organized networks.

item.title: Angle based dynamic learning rate for gradient descent
item.description: In our work, we propose a novel yet simple approach to obtain an adaptive learning rate for gradient-based descent methods on classification tasks.

item.title: Safety Assessment of Chinese Large Language Models
item.description: To further promote the safe deployment of LLMs, we develop a Chinese LLM safety assessment benchmark.

item.title: Nerfbusters: Removing Ghostly Artifacts from Casually Captured NeRFs
item.description: Casually captured Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs) suffer from artifacts such as floaters or flawed geometry when rendered outside the camera trajectory.

item.title: Phoenix: Democratizing ChatGPT across Languages
item.description: This paper presents our efforts to democratize ChatGPT across language.

item.title: Implicit Temporal Modeling with Learnable Alignment for Video Recognition
item.description: While modeling temporal information within straight through tube is widely adopted in literature, we find that simple frame alignment already provides enough essence without temporal attention.

item.title: Securing Neural Networks with Knapsack Optimization
item.description: The second way to accelerate Secure Inference is based on cutting the number of bit comparisons required for a secure ReLU operation.

item.title: NTIRE 2023 Challenge on Light Field Image Super-Resolution: Dataset, Methods and Results
item.description: In this report, we summarize the first NTIRE challenge on light field (LF) image super-resolution (SR), which aims at super-resolving LF images under the standard bicubic degradation with a magnification factor of 4.

item.title: Regularizing Second-Order Influences for Continual Learning
item.description: Continual learning aims to learn on non-stationary data streams without catastrophically forgetting previous knowledge.

item.title: Robust Deep Reinforcement Learning Scheduling via Weight Anchoring
item.description: Questions remain on the robustness of data-driven learning methods when crossing the gap from simulation to reality.

item.title: Automated Dynamic Bayesian Networks for Predicting Acute Kidney Injury Before Onset
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Ranking Approaches for Unknown Structures (RAUS), an automated framework to systematically inform variable ordering and learn networks end-to-end.

item.title: Collaborative Diffusion for Multi-Modal Face Generation and Editing
item.description: In this work, we present Collaborative Diffusion, where pre-trained uni-modal diffusion models collaborate to achieve multi-modal face generation and editing without re-training.

item.title: Contrastive Tuning: A Little Help to Make Masked Autoencoders Forget
item.description: In this work, we study how to combine the efficiency and scalability of MIM with the ability of ID to perform downstream classification in the absence of large amounts of labeled data.

item.title: Density-Insensitive Unsupervised Domain Adaption on 3D Object Detection
item.description: Recently, few works attempt to tackle the domain gap in objects, but still fail to adapt to the gap of varying beam-densities between two domains, which is critical to mitigate the characteristic differences of the LiDAR collectors.

item.title: Evolving Constrained Reinforcement Learning Policy
item.description: Evolutionary algorithms have been used to evolve a population of actors to generate diverse experiences for training reinforcement learning agents, which helps to tackle the temporal credit assignment problem and improves the exploration efficiency.

item.title: Disentangling Neuron Representations with Concept Vectors
item.description: Mechanistic interpretability aims to understand how models store representations by breaking down neural networks into interpretable units.

item.title: Learning Resource Scheduling with High Priority Users using Deep Deterministic Policy Gradients
item.description: Advances in mobile communication capabilities open the door for closer integration of pre-hospital and in-hospital care processes.

item.title: Multi-scale Adaptive Fusion Network for Hyperspectral Image Denoising
item.description: Two key components contribute to improving the hyperspectral image denoising: A progressively multiscale information aggregation network and a co-attention fusion module.

item.title: AMT: All-Pairs Multi-Field Transforms for Efficient Frame Interpolation
item.description: It is based on two essential designs.

item.title: Boosting Semantic Segmentation with Semantic Boundaries
item.description: Motivated by the recent development in improving semantic segmentation by incorporating boundaries as auxiliary tasks, we propose a multi-task framework that uses semantic boundary detection (SBD) as an auxiliary task.

item.title: A Survey of Corpora for Germanic Low-Resource Languages and Dialects
item.description: In this work, we instead focus on low-resource languages and in particular non-standardized low-resource languages.

item.title: Bridging RL Theory and Practice with the Effective Horizon
item.description: We find that prior bounds do not correlate well with when deep RL succeeds vs. fails, but discover a surprising property that does.

item.title: Enhancing Multi-Camera People Tracking with Anchor-Guided Clustering and Spatio-Temporal Consistency ID Re-Assignment
item.description: Multi-camera multiple people tracking has become an increasingly important area of research due to the growing demand for accurate and efficient indoor people tracking systems, particularly in settings such as retail, healthcare centers, and transit hubs.

item.title: Approximate non-linear model predictive control with safety-augmented neural networks
item.description: Our method requires a single evaluation of the NN and forward integration of the input sequence online, which is fast to compute on resource-constrained systems.

item.title: Any-to-Any Style Transfer: Making Picasso and Da Vinci Collaborate
item.description: Existing approaches either apply the holistic style of the style image in a global manner, or migrate local colors and textures of the style image to the content counterparts in a pre-defined way.

item.title: The Face of Populism: Examining Differences in Facial Emotional Expressions of Political Leaders Using Machine Learning
item.description: Online media has revolutionized the way political information is disseminated and consumed on a global scale, and this shift has compelled political figures to adopt new strategies of capturing and retaining voter attention.

item.title: Evaluating Verifiability in Generative Search Engines
item.description: Generative search engines directly generate responses to user queries, along with in-line citations.

item.title: A robust and interpretable deep learning framework for multi-modal registration via keypoints
item.description: Our core insight which addresses these shortcomings is that corresponding keypoints between images can be used to obtain the optimal transformation via a differentiable closed-form expression.

item.title: Learning Robust Visual-Semantic Embedding for Generalizable Person Re-identification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Multi-Modal Equivalent Transformer called MMET for more robust visual-semantic embedding learning on visual, textual and visual-textual tasks respectively.

item.title: Progressive-Hint Prompting Improves Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: The performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in reasoning tasks depends heavily on prompt design, with Chain-of-Thought (CoT) and self-consistency being critical methods that enhance this ability.

item.title: TieFake: Title-Text Similarity and Emotion-Aware Fake News Detection
item.description: We also propose a scale-dot product attention mechanism to capture the similarity between title features and textual features.

item.title: Optimizing Carbon Storage Operations for Long-Term Safety
item.description: In this study, we address these issues by modeling the decision-making process for carbon storage operations as a partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP).
